meanings.definition: Pretend to be ill or unwell in order to avoid work or duty.
meanings.sent1: She decided to malinger to skip the boring meeting.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to malinger when it's time to do chores.
meanings.sent3: The student thought he could malinger to get out of taking the test.
meanings.sent4: The cat seemed to malinger when it was time to go to the vet.
meanings.sent5: The employee's constant malingering eventually caught up with him.

meanings.definition: Exaggerate or feign illness in order to escape responsibilities.
meanings.sent1: She tends to malinger whenever there's a tough project at work.
meanings.sent2: He would often malinger to avoid helping with household tasks.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to malinger by pretending to have a mysterious illness.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was filled with malingered promises.
meanings.sent5: Her constant malingering made her unreliable in the eyes of her colleagues.
